1. The dedicated/targeted media products include 22 radio broadcasts in Uzbek/Russian languages, 10 press communications, 7 videos on child disability, 4 reports on disability assessment/determination, 1 success story and 7 videos on project activities. Together with PUNO, UNDP supported drafting the National Plan of Action for implementation of CRPD. 2.1. Three 5-day capacity building workshops (some 100 hrs) on ICF- and CRPD-compliant disability determination included OPD which are members of the Association of PwD, umbrella organization for 32 OPD, and was broadcast online to ensure wider access across the country. 25 PwD in Karakalpakstan were trained in CRPD and the national legislation on disability. 2.2. The pilot assessment of accessibility/availability of public services run by the Public Services Agency was implemented in Nurafshan, Tashkent province and the respective report shared with OPD and the authorities. UNDP together with OPD Association of PwD conducted another sample survey of accessibility of public services in Nukus, Karakalpakstan. 3.1. The disability assessment commissions under the Agency for Development of Medical Social Services had 3 (three) 1- or 2-day disability determination simulation sessions for child and adult disability determination under ICF and CRPD. The total number of the participants was 116. Together with the Association of PwD and the Construction Ministry national consultations were organized to discuss accessible design and environment and develop recommendations. 3.2. In the framework of LVG, and together with OPD Millenium, sample survey of accessibility of assistance and benefits for vulnerable groups was implemented and its findings shared in a roundtable discussion. UNDP together with OPD Association of PwD conducted another sample survey of accessibility of public services in Nukus, Karakalpakstan. Together with the State Statistics Committee and the Association of PwD, 32 experts of the stakeholder ministries (employment, poverty reduction, economic development, finance, etc.) were trained in disability data collection and use methodologies.

The JPSP was extended for technical reasons by 2 months, namely for conducting the Evaluation and finalizing the reports.
No activities, hence no targets and results are available for Jan-Feb 2022. Outcomes were delivered in 2021.
